data.content:
adjective
US or Brit unfavourable
[more ~; most ~]
likely to cause problems or difficulties
unfavorable [=bad] weather for a camping trip
expressing disapproval
unfavorable [=critical] comments
The movie has gotten some unfavorable [=bad] reviews.
She formed an unfavorable impression of him.
The article cast/put him in an unfavorable light. [=the article made him look bad]
